name: Tropicana Casino and Resort

reviews.text: This hotel was one of the most awful hotels that I have ever stayed. I had some personal items stolen from the security department, and we had informed the front desk numerous times, but no...they did absolutely nothing. My experience with this entire city has been terrible. The streets are dirty, the people are rude, and very irksome.
reviews.title: Vacation from H*ll

likes.disliked: — The awful service (security, front desk, other staff members).

reviews.text: My family and I got back from the Tropicana hotel and casino a few hours ago. We had a great time. The casino was huge and great. New Jersey permits smoking indoors so there were smoking and smoke free casinos. The pool is very nice and the gym was good. There was a whirlpool for guest 18 and older. The pool was crowded though. If a child was like to swim in the indoor pool, an adult must be with the child. There are locker rooms and saunas. The pool is in the south tower which was annoying because the south tower is the oldest and crumiest. The restaurants were okay. The rooms were nice but the beds didn't have fitting sheets. When I called house keeping, they said they don't use fitting sheets. The west tower was very far away from everything else so you had a to walk through a long walk in the quarter which was a shopping and restaurant area designed like a cuban street. The Havana tower was also far from everything else. The hotel was very bad about charges. they tryed to charge us for so much we were suppost to get free. They also tryed to charge us more for our room so we had to fight with them to lower the price. Overall, I had a good and fun experiance but it could have been better.
reviews.title: I liked it but there could be changes!

likes.liked: — Pool, Casino, Sometimes price, theme, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Tropicana for two nights on April 5, 2007. We parked in the main garage and had to take our luggage through several flights of escalators to the hidden lobby. Our Front Desk Rep was very nice, Carmen, she upgraded us to the Havana Tower which was wonderful but to get from that lobby to the Havana Tower you have to go through the casino and through the Quarter to the Havana Tower elevators. The room was a partial oceanview, nice, however the room was quite small and not in excellent condition. The main floor lamp was broken as was the safe when we checked in. The carpet in the hall had a huge, bleach-like stain and the wall had a huge dent on it. The first morning, the maid knocked on the door at 8:30am. We told her we were not ready to have the room done, it turns out that she never came back! Check out was impossible. I had to call the hotel from my cell phone and tell them to check us out and mail us the statement.
reviews.title: Not Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: We dined at the Cuba Libre and Red Square. Both were very good and we would dine there again.
reviews.title: Avoid the South Tower

likes.liked: — The location, several good restaurants--Carmines, The Palm, Ri Ra, PF Changs
likes.disliked: — the room!!!!!!!!!!, construction in the hotel, parking situation

reviews.title: A Quick Trip to the Trop
reviews.text: Room Service: It took 1:45minutes to get breakfast delivered.

Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Tropicana. If I was to return I will reserve a room more expensive than a room in the West Tower. I noted that the hallways were very dirty. We did not have any information about the hotel or room service directory similar to other hotels. I had to discovered the Tropicana by accident just walking around. Also, the maid staff thought it more important to clean a guest's room instead of respecting privacy. A maid came into our room even though the "do not disturb" sign was posted. She argue that she must clean and dial in even though we had just checked in the evening before. Also, couple of times I asked for directions from floor staff and was given wrong information. The walls are paper thin, I heard conversation from other guests located down the the hallways!! The worst - two elevators were down the day we checked out. Even though staff were on the floors no info was given to guests (especially those who were checking out) that the elevators were out of service. We soon discovered the freight elevator used by the bell service and many of us used that elevator to get downstairs. I liked that the Tropicana has so much to offer under its roof, but service could be greatly improve!!
reviews.title: not totally happy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the negative reviews, we had a very nice stay at this hotel/casino. From check-in to check-out not a single problem. The room was large, clean, and comfortable. We ate at the BBQ restaurant (can't remember name) both nights because it was absolutely delicious. The casino was very nice too. We will definately stay here again.
reviews.title: We Will Stay Here Again

reviews.text: I wish there were two separate ways to rank this, one for the casino and on-site amenities and one for the hotel stay. To start with the good: the casino and related amenities are excellent. Great ambiance, very clean and well-kept, and tons to do for gamblers and non-gamblers alike. As part of a large group of family that ranged in age from 10 to 85, I can say there was something for everyone here. Now for the bad: the awful, $270-for-one-stinking-night hotel stay. Check-in was horrendous with an over 40 minute wait (only two employees, one of whom thought a huge line was a good time to count register cash); staff was neither friendly nor courteous, they simply "did their job." Hotel public areas (hallways, lobby by elevators) were in disrepair and quite dirty. Elevator wait time averaged 15 minutes. The room itself was average in appearance, but suffered from a severe case of peeling paint and a mold problem. If in Atlantic City, I would definitely recommend stopping at the Tropicana for its casino facilities. But please, please, stay somewhere else!
reviews.title: Great casino, terrible hotel

reviews.text: The hotel/casino is beautiful filled with fun and excitement, room service came right on time (literally).So much to do, you can eat at hooters, a dam good deli, corky's, etc.There are slot machines left and right; they even have an IMAX theater.As you can see this is the best hotel/casino in Atlantic City.
reviews.title: Super nice!

reviews.text: Travelled to AC during the week for a convention (NJEA). We were very disappointed with the staff of the hotel. They didn't seem to have any info about the convention, shuttle service, etc. We were directed to the Jitney stop and had to find out own way to where the free shuttle buses were picking people up for the convention. With such a large convention you would think management would have given their staff a heads up and made sure they had useful info since there were so many people staying there.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a blast in the Quarter. Great food, great shopping, varied entertainment options, the Quarter is a great place to spend time.
reviews.title: The Quarter was great, the rest of the hotel was just okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The casino is another story. It's a maze, and not your traditional casino maze designed to keep you in. It's just poorly designed, it just creates traffic jams. Sineage throughout the resort is horrible, it's hard to find anything. Even finding the checkin line was a challenge.
reviews.title: Trop is awesome, don't give a thought about booking here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The checkin process was not fun. There were several dozen vehicles abandoned near the entrance (valet parking was very backed up). Bell boys weren't handling luggage, they were directing traffic (unsuccessfully). Nearly all guest were forced to lug their bags up several escalators, through the casino and in most cases through the quarter as well. That is if you could figure out where you were going.
reviews.title: Awful Experiences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checkout wasn't smooth either. Rapid checking via phone didn't work (fast busy), rapid checkout via the TV didn't work, half the checkout kiosks were unavailable as well.
reviews.title: Nice Amenities, Horrible Service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large, comfortable and clean. Nothing special about it but it was quite adequate. Late night gamers and partiers will appreciate the blackout curtains. You'll have no idea whether it's midnight or noon.
reviews.title: Loved our stay

reviews.text: I had a great time, I am just not sure if I would stay here next time, or try some place else. I like the store section & the casino, I was just not that pleased with the hotel experience. The elevators took FOREVER every time we went to our room. The carpets in the hallways did not look like they had been vacuumed daily. There were plastic cups, bottles & trash in the hallways. There was no trash barrel in my bathroom.
reviews.title: Bus trip To Atlantic City

reviews.text: at least they give back for your play! We had a large group and we went to party in Providence we had a blast the promoter was awesome and the dj was on fire! go there! As for the party atmosphere of the West Tower I really didn't mind because that's what I was there for. I love the trop as a whole. Unfortunately I didn't get to play down there this trip but they always take care of me and my friends when I go there. I love the restaurants bars and clubs there. If they upgrade the west tower this would by far be the best place in AC. go there and play and they will take care of you that's why I keep going back!
reviews.title: The Quarter is the best part

reviews.text: Went last week overnight, the casino was very nice, but the hotel was horrible. Mold and peeling paint in the bathroom. Old carpeting and dirty nightstands. The only good thing was that the beds were very comfortable.
reviews.title: Old Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: well things have gotten better we stayed two years ago and i was disappointed but just like anything else you want to give one more chance and wow what a difference everything was clean which is very important to me.i really didnt have any complaints.the only thing i would suggest is that they get better coffee for the rooms what they have now taste really bad but out side of that everything else was fine thank you diane
reviews.title: A Bit Better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice getaway. Great location, nice spacious rooms with a lot of attractions. Get the diamond card for additional discount promotions. Pricey restaurants, bring snacks with you. Kozak the magician was a great show, well worth seeing.
reviews.title: Great getaway, even if you don't gamble.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time staying at an AC resort. We booked the Tropicana through a special on TravelZoo for $55 per night. At this price, it was easier to overlook minor things like worn carpets, a dripping faucet, or a musty/smokey smell. We made the Tropicana home base and also did day trips to cape may, the wild woods, and LBI. Our room was in the new section of the hotel near the Quarter. We walked through a number of the other hotels and casinos and I felt like the trop had so much more to offer. It is not snooty or pretentious nor is it an econo lodge. It was a great value for the money. With great restaurants and a beautiful casino,You could easily be entertained for days without stepping foot outside.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: After reading some of the other reviews prior to going, I didn't have high expectations but the Tropicana came through. It's was clean, comfortable, close to the beach, shopping, the expressway, and we would certainly stay again.
reviews.title: Tropicana....
Terrible stay
reviews.text: I just stayed at the tropicana this past weekend and it left me speechless.

reviews.title: Another Nice Stay
reviews.text: I booked the stay on hotels.com , we were thrown in the west tower which is the oldest tower farthest from everything and know to be a party tower. There is atleast a 20min wait for elevators , how to pass thru security, loud music , partying all hours of the night and security breaking fights at 4am seemed to be normal. Our television ,blow dryer and safe were not working during out stay. Tropicana manager tried to help but since booking this on hotels.com there was nothing he can do.
The outdoor pool was closed on friday and honestly was not somewhere you would want to be.
reviews.title: Resort Info

reviews.text: I really did not think there was anything wrong with this hotel. Maybe just the fact that it is farther down on the boardwalk then most hotels. The room was clean and big. Room service was quick and the order was perfect. check-in and check out was a breeze. I stayed in the Havana tower and it was GREAT to be so close to "the quarter." Valet parking is only $5 for your stay and it does not take long at all to retrieve your car. I will 100% stay here again.
reviews.title: I thought it was great! - Havana Tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just got back from a weekend at the Tropicana. Our first time there, we had limited expectations. I can honestly state that it was a wonderful experience from the time we got out of our car. We got a free upgrade to the Havana Tower. The room was clean and ready, even though we arrived several hours before normal check in. Elevators were quick. Getting from the room to the casino took us through the shops and restaurants, and we really enjoyed that. Casino was large and crowded, but plenty of slots to settle in to. Weather was terrible outside, the noreaster, but that certainly wasn't the casino's fault. Wanted to walk the boardwalk, but weather kept us in. There is no doubt in my mind that when we go back, we will be staying at the Trop. I find it hard to believe that anyone could find fault with this casino.
reviews.title: couldn't have had a better time

reviews.text: My Mother and I visited The Tropicana on the weekend of April 13th....it seemed like Friday the 13th all weekend. First of all after checking in we go to our room....the keys don't work. Back down to the lobby to get the keys re-keyed. Get in the room and it hasnt been cleaned. We didnt have a coffee pot or remote. I saw a guy that worked there in the hallway and asked how I can get a coffee pot.....as he's walking away from me as he talking he says....You have to order it. Yep, he was RUDE !!!! The guy that came to our room about the remote was very nice and he did say they have cut down alot on the help there. Now for the casino....I've never been in such a dirty casino. I didnt see one person going around cleaning up. There were cups and dirty ashtrays everywhere. Then I see this waitress screaming at an elderly women who was asking about a water fountain. To me the slots were very tight. I didnt see many people winning. Alls I have to say is that I would never go back....it was the worst time I've ever had at a casino....
reviews.title: Horrible, Never Again !!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from 3 nights at the Tropicana. I must say I was nervous after reading some of the reviews, but it was GREAT! At check-in, which was quick, I mentioned it was our birthdays. I had booked a regular standard room and was hoping for an oceanview. We were immediately upgraded to a beautiful suite overlooking the water with a spiral staircase to the bedroom and huge jacuzzi! It was spectacular. The staff was helpful and friendly. The restaurants were great, although some were pricey. The bartenders very friendly. The new Havana tower was beautiful. We had a GREAT stay. Would go back in a minute!
reviews.title: Awesome place

reviews.text: If you think you are getting a good deal by not staying in the Havana Tower, think again. The older part of the hotel offers really cheap rooms but the rooms are worn, the sheets have stains all over them and the bathroom makes noises from the water heater all night. I wouldn't stay here again and next time I go to Atlantic Ctiy I will either spend extra money on the Havana Tower (which I would consider because The Quarter has some of the best nightlife in AC) or stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: Run down needs to be rennovated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm local to Atlantic City, so on nights out where we will be drinking, we typically just get a cheap room to stay overnight. I got an awesome internet rate of $50 (plus tax) for a room at the Tropicana after a dinner at Carmine's (always fabulous) and the Beatles' tribute show (a must-see if you are a Beatles fan).
reviews.title: Service & rooms are lacking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in around 6pm, and there was a short line but it moved very quickly. We were "upgraded" to the Havana Tower, which was actually more convenient for us and excited me because I thought the rooms would be nicer. We got to our room (5226) and it has a partial ocean/boardwalk view and view of the other casinos. The room was ok, pretty standard.
reviews.title: Hope you're a heavy sleeper, or maybe you're not planning on sleeping at all.

reviews.text: We went to dinner and the show and returned to our room around 10pm, hoping to order some room service. The first issue I noticed was there is no alarm clock in the room to set our alarm for work the next morning. The second issue was that there is no room service menu or even a hotel information book in the room. Very odd. So, I called the Front Desk (which took 3 tries - I finally called the Operator and had her connect) and asked about a room service menu. They stated they would bring it up, but advised me that since I paid for the room using a debit card I would have to pay cash for the room service. This is not a huge deal to me, but I *always* use a debit card to pay for my casino rooms and have never had an issue charging the room service to my room. The next issue was that we NEVER received the room service menu. We waited about 30 minutes and then just decided to go to sleep.
reviews.title: Wonderful Time!

reviews.text: We noticed the next morning when we showered that the water didn't drain well and thanks to the ivory colored tub, we noticed that the pooling water was brown. We were so annoyed, we just checked out after our showers and left. Thankfully, valet parking was only $5 for hotel guests, so that was a plus.
reviews.title: Mixed bag at the Tropicana

reviews.text: Overall, I wouldn't stay here again. I like the rooms at the other casinos better, the only draw to the Tropicana is the Quarter.
reviews.title: Poor Service, Dated Decor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was very hesitant going to this hotel because the Tropicana in Las Vegas is terrible.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Suprised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is brand new and very clean. There are great restaurants, shops and of course gambling!
reviews.title: MY husband and i luv everything about it,the receptionist was fantastic.

likes.liked: — it made us feel like home away fro home.
likes.disliked: — nothing i guess it was just great,

reviews.text: We arrived and they had ran out of King Size Non-Smoking rooms and upgraded us to a huge suite (it was a Smoking room but didn't smell of it).
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Could use better maid service

likes.liked: — All of the restaurants and shops in the Quarter as well as the expansive casino
likes.disliked: — The hair on my bathroom floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I suggest trying Red Square for dinner and a few martinis.
reviews.title: Nice and clean, good value

reviews.text: We have been to your hotel many times before,but we always say we wanted to sleep overnight and we did,it was great.we are from Barbados and we come to newyork every year in december for a month.everyone we met there welcome us and that made us felt special. Thanks Tropicana.we will be back next time longer.
reviews.title: What the heck happened to the Trop

reviews.text: We just got back from a bus trip to the Tropicana in Atlantic City last night. (5 women and 1 man) I can't say enough about how pleasant it was. All of us thought the rooms were nicely decorated and very clean. The buffet breakfasts were delicious. The staff was helpful.
reviews.title: Would stay again in a heartbeat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read a lot of negative reviews about the Tropicana being dirty. We were all very pleased. We were on three different floors in the West Wing.
reviews.title: Not QUITE a jackpot!

reviews.text: We enjoyed the Christmas show. We ate at Carmine's and Hooters and enjoyed both.
reviews.title: It is what it is......POSITIVES AND NEGATIVES

likes.disliked: — dirty carpets, poor costumer service, NO safe in the room

reviews.text: We are very fussy about where we stay. We have left a hotel to find something better because it wasn't clean enough.
reviews.title: Suprisingly nice but very basic
Dirty Boardwalk Hotel
reviews.text: Hope this help others.

reviews.title: Poker Cashier Clerks are Thieves!
reviews.text: Overall, I had a pleasant experience at the Trop. The room in the North Tower was clean with a partial ocean view, although my account was charged $50.00 over the receipt of my bill. I'm looking into that....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Signing up at the que in the poker room was a little unpleasant. The Trop should retrain some of these people in customer service skills. Getting their attention is like getting blood from a stone sometimes, and their attitude is not necessary. The que board is prehistoric, with the clerk writing your name in with a grease pencil and projected using an overhead projector. Their PA system is as useful as two dixie cups strung together with string. You can't hear any of the announcements.
reviews.title: bad service
Bring a Coffee Maker and other tips for Non-gamblers/Non-smokers
reviews.text: Playing in the poker room was OK , however, when I went to buy chips at the cashier window, one particular cashier agent on two separate occasions tried to short change my chip count. I gave him 200 dollars, and he attempted to give me only 100 dollars in chips. The first time I thought maybe he just made a mistake, but later that night he pulled that crap on me again and I said to him, "You better be careful, I'm on to your little scam." This guy's name was Scott, and he appeared to be from India. Anyway, I scared the little [--] and enjoyed the rest of my stay.

reviews.title: worst experience in hotel ever
reviews.text: Kudos on the decor of the Quarter, the shops, and the check-in agents who greeted me and were very friendly.

We stayed at the Tropicana Casino in Atlantic City last night (March 13th, 2007) our room was just ok (compared to the Hilton in AC which is bigger and nicer) When we were gambling we were looking for a Cocktail waitress (about 2am) but there were none around. We were told that they had just layed off a large majority of the wait staff. The Tango lounge was closed and we were unable to get a drink. I went to the ladys room which was very dirty, toilet was filled and trash cans were not emptied. I stayed last spring at the casino and was given a room that was the size of 2 large walk in closets, we figured that the room we were given was originally the broom closet. This was their last chance I would definetly go back and stay at the Hilton AC (next door same beach)
reviews.title: Just can't recommend the Tropicana

reviews.text: We had a great visit at the Tropicana. We stayed three nights with our teen son. We really loved it and so happy to see that the Tropicana is welcoming families!! We stayed in the Havana Tower on the 67th floor (really think it was about 30 floors but I guess that is how the Trop does it to tell what building you are in??). We love it. Yes, the room was dated but I have to say very clean! We walked about 5 miles a day! The Tropicana is huge!!! I am so happy I didn't wear my heals on this trip!! The Tropicana gave us such a great deal on the room that we made reservations at the "better restaurants". Carmines, Harry Oyster House, Palm, and we did eat a snack at Hooters which was awful!! I do have to say that if you didn't want to leave the Tropicana you didn't have to. The Tropicana Quarter has everything!! Had a great time at the Tropicana and already planning my next trip!!
reviews.title: You will exercise everyday!!

reviews.text: Been staying exclusively at Tropicana for the past four years and I still love it... Once inside you really never need to go outside for anything.. They have shopping, dining, clubs, bars, gambling, spa, Starbucks....just everything... Always stay in Havana tower..its my preference...
reviews.title: Still my #1 place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband for a couple of days just to get away. The hotel is very big it reminded me of Vegas in a way because of all the shops and restaurants although this Trop is bigger than the one in Vegas. I stayed in the North Tower & it was very nice. The room was very spacious, with a King size bed that was very comfy. I liked that the tub and the toilet are separate from the sink and mirror. I was able to do my hair and make-up while my husband showered and I didn't have to worry about the mirror steaming up. The place was very clean. We got lucky our room overlooked the ocean as well as the pool which was on that same side. I did not go into the pool when we looked out the window we noticed it was rather small and very crowded, I hate crowded pools. There was a lot to do and see. If you want to walk the boardwalk this hotel is at the end of the boardwalk and you are very far from the rides and the shops you could take a pedicab or if you like to walk this is a good mile or so. There is no room service so if you get hungry you will have to venture downstairs and find something to eat. You don not have to leave the resort because there are many places that are open late.
reviews.title: Good Getaway

reviews.text: We checked in during a very busy summer week. They still had a room available for us by midafternoon and accomodated all of my family's requests. We were able to get a reservation at PF Chang's on short notice, and even though it was very busy, there was only a 5 minute wait.
reviews.title: Great staff! Large casino.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the North Tower, being with kids I didn't want to have to treck through the casino and through the Quarter to get to our room in the West tower. Easy access to the beach and great fast food for the morning on the boardwalk too.
reviews.title: I always stay at the Tropicana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to AC for his 31st birthday. I got a $59 rate for a Sunday night. Upon arrival we asked for the Havana tower, which we got without paying more. We had a great view of AC and the beach. The room was a normal hotel room, nothing great and nothing bad. I wish the shower pressure was stronger. The Quarter was really nice with shops and restaurants and places to browse around. It looked like some Vegas hotels where the decor looks like you are outside. We ate at the Palm. It was a typical steakhouse.
reviews.title: Decent rooms for the price
TERRIBLE Customer Service! Hidden Fees. Great location.
reviews.text: I wrote a previous review of this hotel, but felt after staying here again I should write another one because of such terrible customer service that I experienced this latest stay.

First of all, I booked online through the Tropicana's website. The price that the website gave me was $99. I printed out this page after my reservation. When I arrived at the hotel to check in ... there was one agent to check people into the Havana Tower. There were 10 people in line. I make no exaggerations when I say that it took almost 40 minutes to be checked in. Every person who was in line seemed to have some problem with their reservation, so things had to be fixed, etc. You would think that they might add another agent to check guests in. This was at a main time where people would check in, about a half hour after the check in hours started. I have never waited this long to check in before. Imagine standing in one place for 40 minutes with luggage after a long drive.
reviews.title: I Go There...

likes.liked: — Rooms are decently good. And I got a free one.
likes.disliked: — Poor food choices. Very expensive if you don't have a free room.

reviews.text: When I finally got to the check in person, I was told that the room rate was $119 per night. I told them that online I booked the rate of $99. She told me that there was no such rate. After telling her I had a print out of the screen and explaining this again, she told me there was nothing she could do. She gave me the fax number of the front desk manager (who was not there) and told me to fax in the information and they might be able to fix it.
reviews.title: good fun with friends!

likes.liked: — convenience to restaurants, clubs, casinos and shops
likes.disliked: — the room was sub-par considering the prices they charge

reviews.title: Awful Customer Service...Noise All Night In Next Room
reviews.text: I emailed someone from the website about all this and she said she would forward my information to this mysterious front desk manager. I hadn't heard back for about 2 weeks, so I emailed again and she said she would look into it. That was a month ago and I haven't heard from anyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Tropicana twice this year (2009) once in the summer (comp and paid room) and once in October (comp). The first time I went with my Mom and eight year old nephew, and the second time just Mom and I stayed there. We had a nice visit both times, we all enjoyed the indoor pool, the magician at the Comedy Stop, and browsing the shops.
reviews.title: Nice place to Stay if you avoid a few pitfalls
We were promised "comped" meals and got stuck with the bill...TWICE!
reviews.text: I just wanted togive some tips that might make your stay more enjoyable. Check-in gets very crowded so get in line early, find out what time check-in starts and get in line way ahead of that time. Keep a bag with you of all needed essentials in case your luggage doesn't arrive in your room within a reasonable amount of time. Our luggage took two hours to arrive after check-in, so Mom didn't have her medicine, and we were stuck in our room all that time not able to go to the beach or use the indoor pool because we didn't have our bathing suits with us.
Don't bother calling the concierge regarding anything, because your calls won't be returned.
reviews.title: Casino nice - hotel not quite what I expected

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet is expensive, but at The Marketplace, there is a coffee stand that sells Krispy Kreme donuts, and Corky's Ribs and BBQ restaurant that serves a $5.99 delicious breakfast special, we discovered these places on our second trip, the Tropicana does not advertise that Corky's Ribs and BBQ serves breakfast. There is no coffee maker in the rooms, so if you enjoy several cups of coffee, bring something you can heat water in and bring your own coffee and you can request a room refrigerator so you can keep milk in it or whatever you like.
reviews.title: Casino Nice, Rooms horrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If this is your first visit ask at the desk in which towers the indoor pool and outdoor pools are, where the different sections for restaurants are "The Quarter", "The Marketplace" etc. Every time I stay I see so much confusion among the guests regarding where everything is, even their room! If you are staying in the West tower, self-park in the West Tower, leave your luggage in the car and then walk across the casino to check in, and wheel your own luggage to your room. If you use Valet Parking and Bell Service to check-in your bags, beware of long waits to get your luggage handled, or to take your car out when you need to leave, I have done both when staying in the West Tower, and it was much more convenient and cheaper to self-park and take my own bags to my room.
reviews.title: Another great stay at the Trop!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading all the negative reviews, I almost canceled our reservation, but decided to see what happened. We paid $69 a night for a standard room in the Havana Tower. At that cheap price, I fully expected a dirty room with a hard bed but we were pleasantly surprised. The room was roomy and attractive in my opinion and most importantly everything was very clean. The bed was super comfortable and soft. We had nothing to complain about. Upon closer inspection I saw that the wood furniture had a couple of dings, but that was not important to me.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

likes.liked: — Clean attractive room with comfortable bed.

reviews.text: From the variety of reviews, it seems that the quality of the various towers and rooms is very inconsistent. We were told the Havana Tower was the newest, but there are negative reviews about the Havana Tower rooms too. I'm not sure why some of the rooms are so dirty but ours was fine. Perhaps it has something to do with how busy the hotel is on a certain date. The hotel did not seem busy when we were there.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings about this hotel

reviews.text: In previous trips we stayed at the Hilton and we like the Tropicana much better. Besides the larger casino there are many bars and restaurants and other places to eat. We didn't have to venture out at night at all because it was all at the Tropicana. We also did not experience unfriendly service.
reviews.title: Terrible customer service, and theft

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bottom line is that we would definitely stay at the Tropicana again, but we would request the Havana Tower.
reviews.title: Not Bad for the price

reviews.text: I am writing this review b/c when it was time to book a hotel in Atlantic City and never had been there before the reviews were either loved it or hated it. I'm not sure if my review will help but I'd like to share my thoughts on The Tropicana.
reviews.title: Majoriy of frontline staff rude

likes.liked: — The bed and linens were excellent
likes.disliked: — The attitudes of most staff were quite rude

reviews.text: Found the hotel to be better than average. I had read reports of bed bugs in Atlantic City and checked the mattress everything looked good, the entire room was very clean, plenty of space and refrigerator, the bath was large. No hairdryers in bathroom but one was delivered when we called.
reviews.title: No problems

reviews.text: The public areas were well kept, several shops and restraunts and of course the casino. Excellent location on the boardwalk and close to other casinos. We had a midweek stay of $99 per night.
reviews.title: Great location, good Casino

reviews.text: This is not a luxury hotel but a great stay for the price. Would stay again.
reviews.title: The trop is ok

reviews.text: We stayed here for a buddy's bachelor party a week ago. It was a pretty good place for a bunch of guys to get together and have a fun weekend. The rooms were relatively clean and comfortable, the hotel had a few good restaurants that were affordable. All in all it was a great place to go for a weekend.
reviews.title: WORST EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE
The Trop is what you make of it.
reviews.text: We stayed at the Tropicana for a friends Bachelor weekend. The hotel is "ok". I will start by saying i was not impressed with Atlantic City as a whole to begin with, what a dirty disgusting place, and I wont be back unless I absolutely have to. Back to the Tropicana our rooms were clean and comfortable. The outdoor pool is not very appealing and I thought there would be more activity on the pool deck. We did not visit the indoor pool. The casino is a typical casino with average shops and restaurants. All in all the Tropicana is not a bad place and worked good for the purpose of the weekend.Atlantic city is not a place I would take my wife for a weekend get away.

We all stayed at the Tropicana during a time when my grankids were off from school. I treated the family to a two night stay. My grankids and their parents in one room and my wife and I in an adjourning room in the Havana Tower. As soon as we got in our room I noticed chocolate candy on the floor in the foyer of the room. I quickly disposed of it so as not to set the tone for the rest of the stay. I looked at the bedspread on the bed in disgust. It was filthy with many un-identifiable stains. I pulled the spread off the bed so as to put it in the closet and my hand touched some still damp, disgusting white stains on the underside of the spread. The blanket under the bed spread was no better with many stains and small holes. I left a note for the housekeeper to get rid of the spread for the rest of our stay. Gratefully, it disappeared the next day. When I took a shower that night, the water didn't drain out of the tub and turned a nice brown color! Eventually it drained but left a residue.
reviews.title: Not Great, Slipping Badly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning, we had tickets for the breakfast buffet. When we got down to it we found it closed. When we inquired we were told that it no longer opens during the week except for weekends. We were directed to a restaurant in the middle of the casino where the line went out into the middle of the casino floor. The kids were starving but we had to wait almost 40 mintues to get a very mediocre breakfast. The next day we discovered a restaurant on the boardwalk next to the Tropicana called the "Country Kitchen". It looked brand new, no line and the breakfast was head and shoulders over what we had in the hotel.
reviews.title: Extremely Dissappointed in my trip to Tropicana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One night we ate in PF Changs in the hotel and the next night in Carmines also in the hotel. They were both great. The Quarter is a fun place to stroll and the grandkids loved the I-Max theater where they were showing a kids movie. The pool was small and dirty looking so we didn't try that. One other bad note. We were in non-smoking rooms but my son's room reeked of cigarette smoke..My daughter-in-law had a spray in her luggage and that helped a lot.
reviews.title: Good night life, so-so rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm sorry to say that this will probably be our last stay at Tropicana and we have been coming here for years.
reviews.title: The Tropicana is the WORST Hotel-Do Not Recommend and Don't Use Valet Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel to Atlantic City from Harrisburg about 2 times a month. I usually stay at Bally's or the Taj but decided to give Tropicana a try. First off, they treat you like you are nothing. There were hairs EVERYWHERE in the bathroom. When I called the front desk, they said they'd send someone up. An hour later still nobody. I went down to the front desk to complain, but instead of offering me another room, they said they'd send someone up. Went back up ... and an hour later...still nobody. Mind you, it's not easy to get from the front desk to your room. It takes about 20-25 mins to get from check-in to your room because of the elevator set-up. So I went down for a third time, and talked to a manager. He gave us another room. This room had no heat, no remote, no soap or clean towels. Looked like it hadn't been touched in years. I am now at the three hour point on my "vacation". I went back down and requested the same manager. Magically, he had gotten off five minutes before I got there. Finally they moved me to a third room that was acceptable and what you would expect in the first room.
reviews.title: Disappointing.

description: Whether you prefer the peaceful serenity of an oceanfront view or the sheer excitement of hitting that winning number, a world-class experience awaits you at the Tropicana, Atlantic Citys entertainment destination. Known for the Luckiest Casino according to Casino Player Magazine, the Tropicana definitely delivers in gaming excitement. The hotels recent expansion includes more than 500 new luxury rooms and suites for a total of more than 2,100making the Tropicana New Jerseys largest hotel.
